Dear Ms. Gale:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
February 6,2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12311 Foster parent/agency agreement
• (3) An agency shall document review of the foster
parent/agency agreement with the foster family at
least annually and, when needed, develop a new
agreement.
Two of six licensing records reviewed, did not have an updated parent agency
agreement.
CPA Rule 400.12312 Foster parent training
• (4) At least 1 adult member of the household must
have training in and maintain a current certification
in first aid and cardiopulmonary resuscitation from
the American Heart Association or the American
Red Cross, or other institution approved by the
department.
Three of six licensing records reviewed did not have documentation that CPR/First
Aid was completed and updated in the case records.
1

CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (2) An agency shall complete written service plans
for each child and parent or parents, as follows:
• (b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial
removal and at least once every 90
calendar days thereafter.
Four of eight foster care case records reviewed were late and passed the 90 days
requirement per the rule.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
11/17/23 RENEWAL, CAP approved 11/28/23
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or
parents and the foster parents in the development
of service plans to enable the parent or parents
and foster parents to understand the plan for the
child and the parents' and the foster parent's role
in assisting the agency in carrying out the plan. An
agency shall give a copy to and review the parent-
agency treatment plan with the parent or parents
and foster parents. The agency must inform the
parent or parents and foster parent that the
information in the parent-agency treatment plan
and any other information about the child and the
child's family is confidential.
Three of eight foster care case records reviewed did not indicate that the plan was
developed with the parent/parents or foster parents to enable the
parent/parents/foster parents to understand the plan.
CPA Rule 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation
• (1) An agency social service worker shall
complete a written adoptive evaluation within 90
days of the family signing an adoption application
and prior to approving a family for adoption.
Two of six adoptive family evaluations were not completed within 90 days of signing
the application.
2

CPA Rule 400.12607 Agency recommendation
• (1) An agency shall recommend the appropriate
action consistent with the facts contained in the
adoptive evaluation. An agency shall make a
written recommendation based on the findings of
the adoptive family evaluation.
One of four adoption case records reviewed did not have a recommendation
included in the adoption assessment.

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance:
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with the individual CAP is as follows.
Renewal Inspections completed on 11/17/23 and CAP submitted on 11/28/23.
The agency was in violation with Rules 209 (1) (A), 418 (2) (B), 510 (2), and
Policy 722-08B and 722-08D. There was one repeated violation during this
reporting period that included late updated service plans.
3

Chief Administrator Assessment:
The Chief Administrator assessment was discussed during the onsite meeting
1/9/2025. The Chief Administrator (CA) accurately identified areas in which
agency staff were non-compliant due to performance issues, new staff training,
and unexpected staff resigning from the agency. The CA reported the agency has
made significant progress in addressing the corrective action plan (CAP) items
related to the development of service plans. To support this improvement, the
agency has implemented a weekly compliance meeting among foster care
leadership. During these meetings, a review of the KPI data in real time,
addresses upcoming deadlines, identify data entry errors, and discuss barriers to
compliance. Additionally, the agency collaborates regularly with their BSC-5 KPI
Analyst to analyze data trends, overcome compliance challenges, and access
valuable resources for adopting best practices. The CA reported these efforts
have been instrumental in enhancing their compliance and overall performance.
Financial Overview:
The Chief Administrator submitted the agency independent financial audit dated
December 31, 2023. The agency annual budget was also submitted. Based on
review, there are no financial concerns.
Staff Interviews:
Interviews were conducted with three staff onsite 1/9/25. All three staff reported
receiving regular and frequent supervision and stated the program director
provides timely information and trainings related to policy and rule
changes/updates. Staff feel very supported by supervisors, co-workers and the
administration. No concerns were identified by any of the interviewed staff.
Description of Agency Walk Through:
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care, licensing and adoption services. All files were stored
securely and there is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety concerns.
4

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
